locutie.beschrijving: Exposition of Jesus as the Way, Truth, and Life, contextualized within the disciples' fear and modern societal greed.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Moderate. Focuses on the narrative tension of the Upper Room and the metaphorical application of 'The Way'.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting the character of Jesus and the state of the world, with occasional shifts to promising the presence of God.
voorbeelden: We are all captives and slaves.
He declares us to have august connections.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To comfort the anxious and reorient the listener's identity from 'consumer' to 'child of God'.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Low. The Spirit is not explicitly mentioned as the agent of the sermon's efficacy.

voorbeelden: The whole thing was coming down to the wire.
Jesus is the way through life's hardness.
Greed has become our new religion.
Brand any religion as false that...
Laugh to scorn any religion that...
Remember how I have taught you.
Quite frankly, they had not bargained.
I will come again and receive you unto myself.
For I will be with thee, thy troubles to bless.
commissieven.kwaliteit: Strong when quoting scripture, but the preacher rarely initiates a commissive in his own voice.

voorbeelden: He declares us to have august connections.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher relies on the authority of the biblical text rather than speaking as a mandatory of Christ.

indicatoren: Third-person descriptions of the disciples' feelings
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a spectator of a narrative rather than a participant in an event.

missende_elementen: Direct promise to the specific congregation
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Information about the 'Way' without being led onto the 'Way'.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Mediated through quotes rather than direct address.
voorbeelden: I will come again and receive you unto myself.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Mostly 'we' (inclusive/homiletic we) to describe human condition.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Occasional address, often in hypothetical or general terms.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Dominant. Describing Jesus, the disciples, and 'the world'.

verleden_tijd.gebruik: Historical narrative of the Upper Room.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General truths about greed and human nature.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (Analysis of greed) -> Directive (Laugh to scorn).
voorbeelden: We are training our children to believe... Laugh to scorn any religion that...
foutief_patroon.probleem: The imperative is not grounded in a preceding declarative of grace.

voorbeelden_slechte_verhouding: Life is real... therefore... laugh to scorn.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions as a high-quality essay or lecture on the theme of John 14:6, but fails to transition into a sacramental event where the Word does what it says.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The whole thing was coming 'down to the wire'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It is a talk *about* an event (the Upper Room) rather than being an event itself.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: Lacks the 'Toezegging' (Promise) directed at the 'You' of the hearer.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: No. God is the subject of the talk, not the speaker of the Word.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Weak. The preacher acts as a commentator.
tekstueel_bewijs: If Jesus told us anything at all...

pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Implicitly assumes that hearing the truth will lead to change.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: No. Sermon as a source of inspiration.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Too many 'is' and 'was' verbs; needs more 'I promise' and 'You are'.

specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, Christ stands before you and opens the way out of your captivity.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Shifts from a fact to an encounter.

toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use the first person to deliver the promise of the text.
voorbeeldzinnen: In the name of Jesus, I promise you: He will not leave you orphaned.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Address the 'You' of the congregation directly with the gospel.
voorbeeldzinnen: You, who feel trapped by greed, hear this: Christ is your way home.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Ground the call to 'laugh to scorn' in the finished work of Christ.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically gifted but homiletically 'stuck' in the third person. Moving from description to address will unlock its sacramental potential.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SvT would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' regarding greed; SAT focuses on the lack of a 'Declarative' act from God.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: Rhetorically, the Samarkand story is excellent; illocutionarily, it is a distraction from the 'here and now' of the Word.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's 'truth' (constative) is high, but its 'felicity' (performative) is low because it fails to 'do' something to the hearer.

appendices.notities: The sermon relies heavily on the 'Samarkand' illustration, which occupies significant locutionary space without adding illocutionary force.
